subject: Technology
title: The First TV Broadcasts
description: A quick win: understand The First TV Broadcasts.

hook.text: The BBC began the world's first regular TV broadcasts in 1936. Fewer than 200 households could actually watch.

buildup.text: Early broadcasts were live because recording technology didn't exist yet. If you missed it, it was gone forever.

discovery.text: The 1936 Berlin Olympics became the first major event broadcast on television, reaching viewers in Berlin's public TV halls.

twist.text: World War II shut down TV broadcasting for years. The BBC's last broadcast before the war was a Mickey Mouse cartoon.

climax.text: After the war, TV exploded. Manufacturers couldn't build sets fast enough to meet demand.

punchline.text: TV launched to almost nobody. After the war, everybody wanted one.

quiz.question: What was the BBC's last broadcast before shutting down for World War II?
